title: Zelensky arrives at Downing Street for talks with UK PM ahead of summit with European leaders
summary: The Ukrainian president arrived at 10 Downing Street on Saturday to meet with UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer. Earlier, Zelensky released a lengthy statement following his showdown with Donald Trump and JD Vance at the White House, emphasizing Ukraine's need for 'peace.'

title: Europe, shocked by explosive Trump-Zelensky White House row, prepares for a decisive summit
summary: Emmanuel Macron, Donald Tusk, Olaf Scholz, Keir Starmer and Ursula von der Leyen immediately threw their support behind the Ukrainian president. They will meet on Sunday, March 2, in London for a summit on Ukraine organized by Starmer.

title: Ukraine's fate more precarious than ever after dramatic Trump-Zelensky clash
summary: What was supposed to be a traditional meeting in front of the cameras in the Oval Office, before the signing of a bilateral mineral agreement, turned into a fiery exchange on Friday, calling into question American support for Kyiv.

title: Gaza truce faces uncertainty as first phase of ceasefire deal nears end
summary: There was no sign of consensus after 'intensive talks' in Cairo on the second phase of the ceasefire. A Hamas spokesperson called on mediators to follow the agreement.

title: PKK declares ceasefire with Turkey after 40 years of armed struggle
summary: Abdullah Ocalan called last Thursday for his Kurdish militant group to lay down its weapons and dissolve itself in a landmark declaration read out in Istanbul.

title: 'Emilia Pérez' wins big at Césars, Julia Roberts receives honorary award
summary: 'Emilia Perez' won big at France's equivalent of the Oscars on Friday evening, taking home seven awards, including best French film of the year.

title: Macron calls for 'calm' after Trump-Zelensky clash
summary: Friday's row, which saw Zelensky ordered out of the White House, has raised fears in Europe over the US commitment to Ukraine's struggle against Russia's invasion. The French president, in an interview on Saturday, said everyone should 'return to calm, respect,' because 'what is at stake is too important.'

title: US to deploy nearly 3,000 additional troops to its border with Mexico
summary: The Trump administration has launched what it cast as a major effort to combat illegal migration that has included immigration raids, arrests and deportations. With border security a top priority for President Trump, he declared the issue a national emergency on his first day in office.

title: Ukrainians angry, in shock after heated Trump-Zelensky White House meeting
summary: Ukrainians backed their President Zelensky after the disastrous exchange, but the country's opposition could take advantage of his failed trip to Washington.

title: Cyclone Garance wreaks havoc on La Réunion island
summary: The cyclone, which crossed the island from north to south between Friday and Saturday, killed at least four people. It also caused extensive damage, notably due to very heavy rainfall.

title: 'Europe refuses to see that Vladimir Putin is in fact waging a war against it and against the West'
summary: In response to the totalitarian pressure exerted on Europe by the Russian president, Karl Schlögel, winner of the 2024 Jacques Delors European Book Prize, reminds us in an op-ed for Le Monde, of the European identity of Ukraine, and sounds the alarm about a return of the 'kidnapped West' evoked by Milan Kundera.

title: Pope Francis spends 'peaceful night' after breathing crisis but 'not out of danger'
summary: Pope Francis was hospitalized on February 14 with bronchitis but his condition deteriorated into double pneumonia, sparking fears over the 88-year-old pontiff's health.

title: Ukraine and Europe, alone against Russia
summary: The violent exchange between Donald Trump, JD Vance and Volodymyr Zelensky at the White House on Friday, February 28, illustrates the hostility of the Trump administration toward Ukraine and signals a breaking point in the relationship between the allies.

title: Trump-Zelensky row, seen from Russia: Pro-Putin media amused by Trump's scolding of 'clown' Zelensky
summary: Former president Dmitry Medvedev set the tone for Russian reactions, both scornful and triumphant, after the heated exchanges at the White House between Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelensky.

title: François Hollande: 'Donald Trump is no longer our ally'
summary: France's former president says that Trump's new term marks 'a profound break' in international relations, particularly with Europe.

title: How France's far right became a mouthpiece for the wine lobby
summary: The election of far-right MPs in traditional winegrowing regions has prompted the party to start championing the wine sector – which isn't necessarily pleased.

title: Duplantis breaks his own pole vault world record with leap of 6.27m
summary: It was the 11th time Sweden's Armand Duplantis had broken the record by one centimeter since first claiming it with a leap of 6.16m in February 2020.

title: Gene Hackman was likely dead for over a week when found, sheriff says
summary: The bodies of the Oscar-winning star of 'The French Connection' and his wife were found on Wednesday, after emergency services were called to the scene when maintenance workers had been unable to access the couple's property in Santa Fe, New Mexico.

title: Israel endorses plan to extend Gaza truce as first phase draws to close
summary: The first phase of a ceasefire deal between Israel and Palestinian militant group Hamas was set to expire over the weekend, but Israel endorsed a proposal put forward by Trump's Middle East envoy Steve Witkoff, which would cover Ramadan, due to end late March, and Passover, lasting through mid-April, according to a statement from the Israeli prime minister's office.

title: Nations fail to break deadlock on UN climate report timing at marathon meeting skipped by US
summary: The meeting was overshadowed by a US decision to stay away, as President Donald Trump unpicks his predecessor Joe Biden's climate actions. Experts warned the US absence from the world's leading scientific body on climate change would be hugely damaging.

title: PSG beats Lille 4-1 to warm up for Liverpool in Champions League
summary: With Saturday's win, PSG extended their unbeaten run in Ligue 1 this season to 24 matches. 'It's a perfect scenario ahead of a game like the one against Liverpool,' said PSG captain Marquinhos.

title: 'Emilia Pérez' and 'L'Histoire de Souleymane' ('Souleymane's Story') win César awards
summary: Well-attended and well-run, the French film awards ceremony on Friday, February 28 was marked by a number of politically-charged speeches.
